Pre-Game Insights: Wales are unbeaten in seven games under Rob Page, with their longest streak without defeat being nine games between September 2021 and March 2022.
Robert Lewandowski has been directly involved in 24 goals in his last 27 appearances for Poland (16 goals, eight assists), but he hasn't scored in any of his three games against Wales.
Poland will need to improve their recent away form, as they have lost three of their four Euro qualifier matches played away from home since the start of 2023.
Harry Wilson has been the most productive Welsh player in the qualifiers, with six goal involvements in nine appearances (three goals, three assists).
Wales have only lost one of their last 15 Euro qualifiers played at the Cardiff City Stadium (W10 D4).
Poland have won each of their last three away games against Wales in competitive action (2001, 2004, 2022).
